comments.body: Since https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/55779 is fixed, this is now safe to enable?

I think the fact that it's fixed doesn't mean anything.
But with endpoint-slices and couple other improvements that happened in the meantime it should be safe to enable it after those 3 years...

It's not clear to me why this test was failing before and why it should pass now.

Could you change commit's description to say what was the issue and how this commit addresses it?

The problem is that for multizonal and regional clusters, we are passing only one of the underlying MIGs in NodeInstanceGroups var (or to be more specific only migs from a single zone are passed there). Also NumNodes is set to the number of nodes in a single zone (similarly to what we'are passing as --num-nodes flag value in gcloud).

Because of that, all the numbers there were incorrect, since they can't be based on those vars.

The description is too long for commit, but I will update PR description.

FYI we had the same issue in CA e2e tests, which rely on this car to get full MIG info and I have added a flag to make kubetest pass all the MIGs in NodeInstanceGroups var (https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/pull/6507).
I left the default behavior unchanged since it was unclear if it wouldn't break other tests in an unexpected way but we set --gke-single-zone-node-instance-group=false in our regional autoscaling tests.
